def ingest_raw_to_standardised():
    '''
    Function reads all the schedules for all files, and processes any new files into standardised, and adds outstanding files into an outstanding files table
    Parameters:
    None

    Returns:
    None

    Actions:
    Processes files from raw to standardised based on a schedule, and will also keep track of files that haven't arrived and attempt to process those

    '''
    ### module imports
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    import logging
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
    import json
    from notebookutils import mssparkutils
    import pandas as pd
    logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    from datetime import datetime, timedelta, date
    from pyspark.sql.types import StringType,BooleanType,DateType,TimestampType,IntegerType, FloatType, StructType
    from delta.tables import DeltaTable
    from croniter import croniter
    import re
    from pyspark.sql.functions import col, lit
    import calendar

    ### use the ADLS gen2 assoicated with the synapse resource in any environment (DR/Dev/Stage/Prod)
    storage_acc_name = spark.sparkContext.environment.get('dataLakeAccountName', 'get')

    ### create outstanding files table
    outstanding_files_table_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/scheduling_outstanding_files_table.json", wholetext=True).first().value
    create_table_from_schema(outstanding_files_table_json, "odw_config_db", "raw_to_std_outstanding_files", "abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/", "config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files" )

    ### loads json for scheduling
    orchestration_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/orchestration.json", wholetext=True).first().value
    json_config_dict = json.loads(orchestration_json)
    
    ### process outstanding files
    outstanding_df = spark.read.format("delta").load("abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
    ### make sure there are entries in the outstanding files table
    if outstanding_df.count() > 0: 
        outstanding_df_pd = outstanding_df.toPandas()
        for pdidx, pdrow in outstanding_df_pd.iterrows():
            time_now = pdrow['Expected_Datetime'] 
            outstanding_source_id = pdrow['DefinitionID'] 
            definitions = json_config_dict['definitions']
            for defs in definitions:
                ### isolate the scheduling config for the entry in the oustanding files table
                if defs['Source_ID'] == outstanding_source_id: 
                    standardised_container = "abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/" # defs['Standardised_Container'] + "/"
                    standardised_table_name = defs['Standardised_Table_Name']
                    standardised_path = defs['Standardised_Path'] + "/"
                    standardised_table_loc = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/" + defs['Standardised_Table_Definition']
                    standardised_table_def_json = spark.read.text(standardised_table_loc, wholetext=True).first().value
                    create_table_from_schema(standardised_table_def_json, "odw_standardised_db", standardised_table_name,standardised_container , standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                    deltadays = defs['Expected_Within_Weekdays']

                    ### expected from - change from normal process
                    last_start_dt = time_now 
                    
                    ### expected to - change from normal process
                    next_end_dt = last_start_dt + timedelta(days=deltadays) 

                    if last_start_dt <= time_now < next_end_dt: 
                        standardised_table_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                        ### check if the file has already been ingested
                        rows = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()
                        
                        if rows > 0 :
                            logger.info("File has already been ingested")
                        else:
                            source_container_path = "abfss://odw-raw@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/" 
                            if defs["Source_Frequency_Folder"] == "":
                                source_folder =  defs['Source_Folder'] +"/"
                            ### handle weekly / monthly sub folders
                            else:                            
                                source_folder =  defs['Source_Folder'] +"/"+ defs["Source_Frequency_Folder"] + "/"
                            ### find correct weekly folder 
                            date_folders = mssparkutils.fs.ls(source_container_path+source_folder)
                            for datex in date_folders:
                                date_string = datex.name 
                                ### handle YYYY-MM-DD dates
                                if len(date_string) == 10:
                                    folder_date = datetime.strptime(date_string, "%Y-%m-%d")
                                ### handle YYYY-MM dates
                                elif len(date_string) == 7:
                                    folder_date = datetime.strptime(date_string, "%Y-%m")
                                    
                                    folder_date = date(folder_date.year, folder_date.month, calendar.monthrange(folder_date.year, folder_date.month)[-1]) + timedelta(days=1)
                                    folder_date = datetime.combine(folder_date, datetime.min.time())
                                else:
                                    raise ValueError("Date format in raw folder is incorrect, should be YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM")
                                if last_start_dt <= folder_date < next_end_dt:
                                    source_folder_with_date = mssparkutils.fs.ls(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string)
                                    if source_folder_with_date == []:
                                        error_folder_string = source_container_path+source_folder+date_string
                                        raise RuntimeError(f"Folder is empty within {error_folder_string}")
                                    for file in source_folder_with_date:
                                        filename = file.name 
                                        ### isolate the correct file
                                        if defs['Source_Filename_Start'] in filename:
                                            jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
                                            ### mount the data lake storage in Synapse to the Synapse File Mount API
                                            mount_storage(path=source_container_path+source_folder+date_string)
                                            
                                            ### open .csv and .xlsx files using pandas
                                            if ".xlsx" in filename.lower():
                                                sheet_name = defs['Source_Sheet_Name'] if 'Source_Sheet_Name' in defs else 0
                                                df = pd.read_excel(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", dtype=str, sheet_name=sheet_name, na_filter=False)
                                            elif '.csv' in filename.lower():
                                                df = pd.read_csv(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", quotechar='"',escapechar='\\',encoding="utf8",dtype=str, na_filter=False)
                                            elif '.json' in filename.lower():
                                                df = pd.read_json(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", encoding="utf8", dtype=str)
                                            else:
                                                raise RuntimeError(f"This file type for {filename} is unsupported")
                                            ### drop headerless columns
                                            df = df.loc[:, ~df.columns.str.contains('^Unnamed')]
                                            rows_raw = len(df.index)
                                            unmount_storage()
                                            ### convert to pandas dataframe
                                            sparkDF=spark.createDataFrame(df)
                                            ### add date columns included with every standardised table
                                            sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("ingested_datetime",lit(datetime.now()))
                                            sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_from",lit(last_start_dt))
                                            sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_to",lit(next_end_dt))
                                            schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(standardised_table_def_json))
                                            
                                            ### remove characters that Delta can't allow in headers and add numbers to repeated column headers
                                            cols_orig = sparkDF.schema.names
                                            cols=[re.sub('[^0-9a-zA-Z]+', '_', i).lower() for i in cols_orig]
                                            cols=[colm.rstrip('_') for colm in cols]
                                            newlist = []
                                            for i, v in enumerate(cols):
                                                totalcount = cols.count(v)
                                                count = cols[:i].count(v)
                                                newlist.append(v + str(count + 1) if totalcount > 1 else v)
                                            for colix in range(len(cols_orig)):
                                                sparkDF = sparkDF.toDF(*newlist) 

                                            ### mappings for Json schema definitions to Pyspark data types
                                            mapping = {
                                                'string': StringType(),
                                                'timestamp': TimestampType(),
                                                'integer': IntegerType(),
                                                'date': DateType(),
                                                'float': FloatType()
                                            }

                                            ### column data type casting
                                            for field in json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)['fields']:
                                                sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn(field['name'], col(field['name']).cast(mapping[field['type']]))
                                            colheaders = []
                                            for field in json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)['fields']:
                                                colheaders.append(field['name'])
                                            sparkDF = sparkDF.select(colheaders)
                                            sparkDF2 = spark.createDataFrame(sparkDF.rdd, schema=schema)
                                            ### writing the dataframe to the existing standardised table
                                            sparkDF2.write.format("delta").mode("append").saveAsTable(f"odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")

                                            standardised_table_df_new = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                                            rows_new = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()

                                            ### test correct number of rows have written
                                            if rows_raw == rows_new:
                                                mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs(source_container_path+"archive"+"/"+source_folder+date_string+"/")
                                                mssparkutils.fs.cp(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string+"/"+filename,source_container_path+"archive"+"/"+source_folder+date_string+"/"+filename)
                                                spark.sql(f"DELETE FROM odw_config_db.raw_to_std_outstanding_files WHERE Expected_Datetime = '{time_now}' and DefinitionID = {outstanding_source_id}")
                                                logger.info('All rows have successfully written')
                                            ### delete transaction if incorrect number of rows has written and raise an error
                                            else:
                                                deltaTable_standardised = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                                                fullHistoryDF = deltaTable_standardised.history()
                                                fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version']
                                                deltaTable_standardised.restoreToVersion(fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version'] - 1)
                                                raise RuntimeError(f"Incorrect number of rows have been written to the standardised table {standardised_table_name}, rolled back to original version")

    ### regular ingestion process 


    time_now = datetime.now() ### ingested_datetime
    definitions = json_config_dict['definitions']
    for defs in definitions:
        standardised_container = "abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/" 
        standardised_table_name = defs['Standardised_Table_Name']                 
        if defs['Standardised_Path'] != table_grouping:
            continue
        standardised_path = defs['Standardised_Path'] + "/"
        standardised_table_loc = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/" + defs['Standardised_Table_Definition']
        standardised_table_def_json = spark.read.text(standardised_table_loc, wholetext=True).first().value
        create_table_from_schema(standardised_table_def_json, "odw_standardised_db", standardised_table_name,standardised_container , standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
        
        cronstart = 'Adhoc'
        deltadays = defs['Expected_Within_Weekdays']
        
        ### ignore any adhoc file being ingested
        if cronstart == 'Adhoc':
            continue

        iter_start = croniter(cronstart, time_now)
        last_start_dt = iter_start.get_prev(datetime) ### expected from
        
        next_end_dt = last_start_dt + timedelta(days=deltadays) ### expected to
    
        ### check if the file is being expected right now, less than with the expected_to value means no overlaps in expected periods
        if last_start_dt <= time_now < next_end_dt: 
            folder_available = False
            standardised_table_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
            rows = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()
            ### check if the file has already been ingested
            if rows > 0 :
                folder_available = True
                logger.info("File has already been ingested")
            else:
                source_container_path = "abfss://odw-raw@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/" # defs['Source_Container_Path'] + "/"
                if defs["Source_Frequency_Folder"] == "":
                    source_folder =  defs['Source_Folder'] +"/"
                ### handle weekly / monthly sub folders
                else:                            
                    source_folder =  defs['Source_Folder'] +"/"+ defs["Source_Frequency_Folder"] + "/"
                ### find correct weekly folder 
                date_folders = mssparkutils.fs.ls(source_container_path+source_folder)
                for datex in date_folders:
                    date_string = datex.name
                    ### handle YYYY-MM-DD dates
                    if len(date_string) == 10:
                        folder_date = datetime.strptime(date_string, "%Y-%m-%d")
                    ### handle YYYY-MM dates
                    elif len(date_string) == 7:
                        folder_date = datetime.strptime(date_string, "%Y-%m")
                        folder_date = date(folder_date.year, folder_date.month, calendar.monthrange(folder_date.year, folder_date.month)[-1]) + timedelta(days=1)
                        folder_date = datetime.combine(folder_date, datetime.min.time())
                    else:
                        raise ValueError("Date format in raw folder is incorrect, should be YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM")
                    
                    if last_start_dt <= folder_date < next_end_dt:
                        folder_available = True
                        source_folder_with_date = mssparkutils.fs.ls(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string)
                        if source_folder_with_date == []:
                            error_folder_string = source_container_path+source_folder+date_string
                            raise RuntimeError(f"Folder is empty within {error_folder_string}")
                        file_available = False
                        for file in source_folder_with_date:
                            ### isolate the correct file
                            filename = file.name 
                            if defs['Source_Filename_Start'] in filename:
                                file_available = True
                                
                                ### mount the data lake storage in Synapse to the Synapse File Mount API
                                jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
                                mount_storage(path=source_container_path+source_folder+date_string)
                                ### open .csv and .xlsx files using pandas
                                if ".xlsx" in filename.lower():
                                    sheet_name = defs['Source_Sheet_Name'] if 'Source_Sheet_Name' in defs else 0
                                    df = pd.read_excel(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", dtype=str, sheet_name=sheet_name, na_filter=False)
                                elif '.csv' in filename.lower():
                                    df = pd.read_csv(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", quotechar='"',escapechar='\\',encoding="utf8",dtype=str, na_filter=False)
                                elif '.json' in filename.lower():
                                    df = pd.read_json(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", encoding="utf8", dtype=str)
                                else:
                                    raise RuntimeError(f"This file type for {filename} is unsupported")
                                ### drop headerless columns
                                df = df.loc[:, ~df.columns.str.contains('^Unnamed')]
                                rows_raw = len(df.index)
                                unmount_storage()
                                ### convert to pandas dataframe
                                sparkDF=spark.createDataFrame(df)
                                ### add date columns included with every standardised table
                                sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("ingested_datetime",lit(datetime.now()))
                                sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_from",lit(last_start_dt))
                                sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_to",lit(next_end_dt))
                                schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(standardised_table_def_json))

                                
                                ### remove characters that Delta can't allow in headers and add numbers to repeated column headers
                                cols_orig = sparkDF.schema.names
                                cols=[re.sub('[^0-9a-zA-Z]+', '_', i).lower() for i in cols_orig] 
                                cols=[colm.rstrip('_') for colm in cols]
                                newlist = []
                                for i, v in enumerate(cols):
                                    totalcount = cols.count(v)
                                    count = cols[:i].count(v)
                                    newlist.append(v + str(count + 1) if totalcount > 1 else v)
                                for colix in range(len(cols_orig)):
                                    sparkDF = sparkDF.toDF(*newlist) 
                                
                                ### mappings for Json schema definitions to Pyspark data types
                                mapping = {
                                    'string': StringType(),
                                    'timestamp': TimestampType(),
                                    'integer': IntegerType(),
                                    'date': DateType(),
                                    'float': FloatType()
                                }

                                ### column data type casting
                                for field in json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)['fields']:
                                    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn(field['name'], col(field['name']).cast(mapping[field['type']]))
                                colheaders = []
                                for field in json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)['fields']:
                                    colheaders.append(field['name'])
                                sparkDF = sparkDF.select(colheaders)
                                sparkDF2 = spark.createDataFrame(sparkDF.rdd, schema=schema)
                                ### writing the dataframe to the existing standardised table
                                sparkDF2.write.format("delta").mode("append").saveAsTable(f"odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")

                                standardised_table_df_new = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                                rows_new = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()
                                ### test correct number of rows have written
                                if rows_raw == rows_new:
                                    mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs(source_container_path+"archive"+"/"+source_folder+date_string+"/")
                                    mssparkutils.fs.cp(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string+"/"+filename,source_container_path+"archive"+"/"+source_folder+date_string+"/"+filename)
                                    logger.info('All rows have successfully written')
                                
                                ### delete transaction if incorrect number of rows has written and raise an error
                                else:
                                    ### add to outstanding files table?
                                    deltaTable_standardised = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                                    fullHistoryDF = deltaTable_standardised.history()    # get the full history of the table
                                    fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version']
                                    deltaTable_standardised.restoreToVersion(fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version'] - 1)
                                    raise RuntimeError(f"Incorrect number of rows have been written to the standardised table {standardised_table_name}, rolled back to original version")

                        if file_available==False:
                            outstanding_struct_schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(outstanding_files_table_json))
                            new_outst_file = spark.createDataFrame([[last_start_dt, defs['Source_ID']]], outstanding_struct_schema)
                            outstanding_df = spark.read.format("delta").load("abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
                            outstanding_df = outstanding_df.union(new_outst_file).dropDuplicates()
                            outstanding_df.write.format("delta").mode("overwrite").save("abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
            if folder_available==False:
                outstanding_struct_schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(outstanding_files_table_json))
                new_outst_file = spark.createDataFrame([[last_start_dt, defs['Source_ID']]], outstanding_struct_schema)
                outstanding_df = spark.read.format("delta").load("abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
                outstanding_df = outstanding_df.union(new_outst_file).dropDuplicates()
                outstanding_df.write.format("delta").mode("overwrite").save("abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
